Key Arguments: The legislation undermines the ability of citizens to distinguish between false and plausible information.
Government intervention in determining correct data violates individual freedom of thought and decision-making.
The proposal contradicts the principles of education and literacy that empower citizens to critique information.
Main Themes: Role of education and literacy in discerning information
Notable Quotes: It is therefore inexplicable that a modern, progressive government could propose legislation that presupposes that its citizens are incapable of distinguishing false from plausible information.
The further intervention of a government agency in the determination of correct data violates the very principle of the millennia of struggle for individual freedom of thought and decision making.
